subject: RE: [junit] how to generate a single report for all programs test cases
msgSnippet: Hi Mougli This is what we re doing at it s giving us only one html report.
messageBody:
Hi Mougli

This is what we're doing at it's giving us only one html report.

<target name="test" depends="testdirectories"
description="Test with JUnit" >
<junit fork="on" dir="${build}" showoutput="true">
<classpath refid="testlibs" />
<classpath path="${build.testclasses}" />
<classpath path="${project.jar}" />
<classpath path="${resources.jar}" />
<formatter type="xml" />
<jvmarg line="-Xmx256m -Xss8192k"/>
<sysproperty key="user.dir" value="${testrun}"/>

<batchtest fork="yes">
<fileset dir="${tests}">
<include name="**/*Test.java"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>

</junit>
</target>

<target name="report" depends="test"
description="Transform test results from xml to html">

<!-- Create directories -->
<mkdir dir="${reports.dir}"/>

<!-- Move the XML output to report directory -->
<move todir="${reports.dir}">
<fileset dir=".">
<include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
</fileset>
</move>

<junitreport todir="${reports.dir}">
<fileset dir="${reports.dir}">
<include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
</fileset>
<report format="noframes" todir="${reports.dir}"/>
</junitreport>
</target>

Hope it kan help you.

Morten

> -----Original Message-----
> From: g d [mailto:mougli213@...]
> Sent: 23 November 2004 06:35
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] how to generate a single report for all programs test
> cases
>
>
>
> hi friends,
>
> We know that using apache ant and Junit reports we can generate
>
> Html report for single Program(i.e. for eg: SimpleTest.java). similarly we
>
> can generate different html report for second program(i.e. for eg:
>
> AllTest.java).
>
> But My Problem is that "this two Html reports must come in a
>
> single Html report." or else we should provide one html report providing
>
> links to view different html reports
>
>
> Regards
>
> Mougli
